message.content:
This depends on the context and individual person receiving advice. Some people might appreciate brutal honesty, while others may prefer a more gentle approach.

For some, brutal honesty can feel helpful because it gets straight to the point, avoiding sugarcoating or minimizing the issue at hand. This type of feedback can lead to quicker recognition of problems and spur action for improvement.

On the other hand, there are those who respond better to constructive criticism that is presented gently and sensitively. Emphasizing specific areas which need improvement while also acknowledging their strengths helps them maintain confidence in their abilities while working toward growth.

Ultimately, what matters most is knowing your audience and understanding how they best receive feedback. A one-size-fits-all approach won't always work; good communication involves adapting your style based on both context and recipient for maximum effectiveness.
